com.stripe.stripeterminal

Class PaymentIntentParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentParameters

  • public class PaymentIntentParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    The PaymentIntentParameters class contains information that will be used for the creation of a new PaymentIntent. To create a PaymentIntentParameters instance, the PaymentIntentParameters.Builder class should be used.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PaymentIntentParameters.Builder
      The PaymentIntentParameters.Builder class provides a convenient way to create a new PaymentIntentParameters instance without having to deal with parameters that aren't relevant to your integration.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        public java.lang.Integer getAmount()
        The amount of the payment, provided in the currency's smallest unit.
        See Also:
        Zero Decimal

      • getApplicationFeeAmount

        public java.lang.Integer getApplicationFeeAmount()
        The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be applied to the payment and transferred to the application ownerâ€™s Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the stripeAccount property or an OAuth key. The amount must be provided as an int in the currency's smallest unit.
        See Also:
        Collecting Fees

      • getCurrency

        public java.lang.String getCurrency()
        Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.
        See Also:
        Currencies

      • getCustomer

        public java.lang.String getCustomer()
        The ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent is for, if one exists.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        An arbitrary string attached to the object. If you send a receipt email for this payment, the email will include the description.

      • getMetadata

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadata()
        Map of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

      • getOnBehalfOf

        public java.lang.String getOnBehalfOf()
        The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. When transferDataDestination is specified, onBehalfOf must also be specified and must match the destination of the transfer.
        See Also:
        On Behalf Of

      • getReceiptEmail

        public java.lang.String getReceiptEmail()
        Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.
        See Also:
        Receipts

      • getStatementDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getStatementDescriptor()
        A string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. The statement descriptor must contain at least one letter, may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks and card issuers display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

      • getTransferDataDestination

        public java.lang.String getTransferDataDestination()
        The account (if any) the payment will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success. At capture time, use transfer_data[amount] to specify the amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds.

      • getTransferGroup

        public java.lang.String getTransferGroup()
        A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group.
        See Also:
        Grouping Transactions
